element.name: The Summit by Obelix, Traditional Cache (2/2.5)
element.description: This is a tourist cache ie, it can be reached using public transport - The DART - from the centre of Dublin. I have rated it using the Geocache system, the rating would be less if approached by car.
element.long-description:
Take the DART from Tara Street (nearest to city centre) to Howth station. Turn left (East) as you exit the station and head for Mc Guirk's golf shop. Turn right up Abbey St and head up the hill passing to the right of the church. Keep going until you turn right up Wingate Road. You are now looking for waypoint N 53째 11.122 W 006째 04.122 you should be exactly two miles from Howth Station. Go through the gate and take the path to the cache - let your GPS do the rest!
It is possible to park your car near the above waypoint.
The cache is in a tupperware container inside a green plastic bag and contains a camera, Geocaching key ring, pack of crayons, measuring tape etc.
The view of the city and the bay make this a worthwhile trip, good luck and a "Happy New Year fellow Geocachers"
element.encoded-hints: Gloves would be useful as the cache is hidden in prickly gorse!

ul.li:
2010-06-05T19:00:00Z : Found it by EIMHK
Found this while caching around Howth today - at the cache location theres a lot of rubbish bins lying around - but otherwise TFTC

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by eclipsearch
12.43 Found on a school trip to Dublin Out: TB: Corner Gas No other TBs in there
-- the box is damaged -- TFTC
greetings from Germany eclipsearch

2010-05-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by SharpSwords
Found with friends and had a long walk up the hill with loads of ouches!!!!!!!! Finally some of us stayed a bit back while Dad and Jake went to look for it!!! They found it and Killian picked up a finnger puppet and a rubber ball and Eoin took a pokemon card and we left 2 pens also dropped of a Corner Gas adventure guide that we had picked up in Western Australia!!!!!!!!!!!!!

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Nice walk to this cache & lovely views from the top. TFTC Toffee Man #338

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Lovely walk to this one and the views are fantastic. I think this may be the oldest cache we've found.[:D] The box is a little damaged and the book damp but we signed our names anyhow. No TB's there. TFTC and bringin us to this lovely place. No gorse at cache site - no gloves required. Blue Jay 59 #339

2008-11-09T20:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Out with Gavin and Anton today. Approached from Aideen's Grave which was a round-about way and quite soggy.
Soon got to the spot where we had to kind of make our own path through the prickly bushes - not so bad as we all had sturdy shoes and jeans on, but wouldn't want to lose my footing!
Cache itself is quite badly in need of maintenance, log book is full but I managed to squeeze a sticker on the last page there.
Fabulous views too, and the pub of the same name was welcome respite from the cold and rain.

2008-11-09T18:50:03Z : Needs Maintenance by Kersti.com
Hi, cache lid is broken, log book is chockers full and the contents are a bit icky and quite damp.
